thread.title: Arian Foster suffers Achilles injury, doctors fear it's torn
thread.title_full: Arian Foster suffers Achilles injury, doctors fear it's torn - CBSSports.com

author: Will Brinson
title: Arian Foster suffers Achilles injury, doctors fear it's torn
text:
On a meaningless, late-game snap in a blowout loss, Arian Foster suffered what could be a major injury to his Achilles. 
Foster, lined up in the slot on a red-zone play with the Texans trailing 44-20 in Miami, took a step forward and fell to the ground without any contact.
He was in serious pain on the ground and was helped off by trainers. 
Arian Foster injured, helped off with non-contact injury: https://t.co/02rk3feFCo https://t.co/f0QjlUZwEy 
â€” AOL Sports (@AOLSports) October 25, 2015 Bill O'Brien wouldn't confirm the injury but acknowledged the injury wasn't the prettiest thing to see.
"I don't know that yet, but it obviously didn't look good," O'Brien said.
He'll have to answer some questions about what Foster was doing in the game, too. The Texans aren't going to roll over and give up or anything. But if you've got a star running back who came back from injury a few weeks ago and you're leaving him in the game down 24 points, you're responsible if he suffers a season-ending injury.
If Foster's Achilles injury is a full tear -- and according to Adam Schefter of ESPN doctors fear it's torn -- he'll be done for the year and a very bad Texans season will have gotten much worse.

Foster suffered an Achilles injury on Sunday. (USATSI) 

Topics: Arian Foster , Will Brinson , Houston Texans , NFL
